verses.verse: Then Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>,
Can a man<WH1397> be profitable<WH5532> unto God<WH410>, as<WH3588> he that is wise<WH7919> may be profitable unto himself<WH5532>?
Is it any pleasure<WH2656> to the Almighty<WH7706>, that you are righteous<WH6663>? or is it gain<WH1215> to him<WH1870>, that you make your ways perfect<WH8552>?
Will he reprove<WH3198> you for fear<WH3374> of you<WH935>? will he enter with you into judgment<WH4941>?
Is not your wickedness<WH7451> great<WH7227>? and your iniquities<WH5771> infinite<WH7093>?
For you have taken a pledge<WH2254> from your brother<WH251> for nothing<WH2600>, and stripped<WH6584> the naked<WH6174> of their clothing<WH899>.
You have not given water<WH4325> to the weary<WH5889> to drink<WH8248>, and you have withheld<WH4513> bread<WH3899> from the hungry<WH7457>.
But as for the mighty<WH2220> man<WH376>, he had the earth<WH776>; and the honorable man<WH5375> lived in it<WH3427>.
You have sent<WH7971> widows<WH490> away empty<WH7387>, and the arms<WH2220> of the fatherless<WH3490> have been broken<WH1792>.
Therefore snares<WH6341> are round about<WH5439> you<WH6597>, and sudden fear<WH6343> troubles you<WH926>;
Or darkness<WH2822>, that you can not see<WH7200>; and abundance<WH8229> of waters<WH4325> cover you<WH3680>.
Is not God<WH433> in the height<WH1363> of heaven<WH8064>? and behold<WH7200> the height<WH7218> of the stars<WH3556>, how high they are<WH7311>!
And you say<WH559>, How does God<WH410> know<WH3045>? can he judge<WH8199> through the dark cloud<WH6205>?
Thick clouds<WH5645> are a covering<WH5643> to him<WH7200>, that he sees not<WH1980>; and he walks in the circuit<WH2329> of heaven<WH8064>.
Have you marked<WH8104> the old<WH5769> way<WH734> which wicked<WH205> men<WH4962> have trodden<WH1869>?
Which were cut down<WH7059> out of time<WH6256>, whose foundation<WH3247> was overflown<WH3332> with a flood<WH5104>:
Which said<WH559> unto God<WH410>, Depart<WH5493> from us<WH7706>: and what can the Almighty do for them<WH6466>?
Yet he filled<WH4390> their houses<WH1004> with good<WH2896> things<WH6098>: but the counsel of the wicked<WH7563> is far from me<WH7368>.
The righteous<WH6662> see<WH7200> it<WH8055>, and are glad: and the innocent<WH5355> laugh them to scorn<WH3932>.
Whereas<WH518> our substance<WH7009> is not cut down<WH3582>, but the remnant<WH3499> of them the fire<WH784> consumes<WH398>.
Acquaint<WH5532> now yourself with him<WH7999>, and be at peace: thereby good<WH2896> shall come unto you<WH935>.
Receive<WH3947>, I pray you<WH8451>, the law from his mouth<WH6310>, and lay up<WH7760> his words<WH561> in your heart<WH3824>.
If you return<WH7725> to the Almighty<WH7706>, you shall be built up<WH1129>, you shall put away<WH7368> iniquity<WH5766> far<WH7368> from your tabernacles<WH168>.
Then shall you lay up<WH7896> gold<WH1220> as<WH5921> dust<WH6083>, and the gold of Ophir<WH211> as the stones<WH6697> of the brooks<WH5158>.
Yes<WH7706>, the Almighty shall be your defense<WH1220>, and you shall have plenty<WH8443> of silver<WH3701>.
For then shall you have your delight<WH6026> in the Almighty<WH7706>, and shall lift up<WH5375> your face<WH6440> unto God<WH433>.
You shall make your prayer<WH6279> unto him<WH8085>, and he shall hear you<WH7999>, and you shall pay your vows<WH5088>.
You shall also decree<WH1504> a thing<WH562>, and it shall be established<WH6965> unto you<WH216>: and the light shall shine<WH5050> upon your ways<WH1870>.
When men are cast down<WH8213>, then you shall say<WH559>, There is lifting up<WH1466>; and he shall save<WH3467> the humble<WH7807> person<WH5869>.
He shall deliver<WH4422> the island<WH336> of the innocent<WH5355>: and it is delivered<WH4422> by the pureness<WH1252> of your hands<WH3709>.
